item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Friday, May 9, 2025 at 8:20 PM UTC
item.description:
1. ALICE detects the conversion of lead into gold at the LHC (367 points | 197 comments)
2. Launch HN: Nao Labs (YC X25) – Cursor for Data (75 points | 36 comments)
3. Inventing the Adventure Game (1984) (25 points | 1 comment)
4. Past, present, and future of Sorbet type syntax (80 points | 37 comments)
5. Sofie: open-source web based system for automating live TV news production (211 points | 29 comments)
6. 21 GB/s CSV Parsing Using SIMD on AMD 9950X (199 points | 88 comments)
7. New Tool: lsds – List All Linux Block Devices and Settings in One Place (35 points | 4 comments)
8. Show HN: Oliphaunt – A native Mastodon client for macOS (52 points | 17 comments)
9. Itter.sh – Micro-Blogging via Terminal (134 points | 39 comments)
10. Show HN: Aberdeen – An elegant approach to reactive UIs (153 points | 85 comments)
11. Why 536 was 'the worst year to be alive' (2018) (33 points | 5 comments)
12. Show HN: A backend agnostic Ruby framework for building reactive desktop apps (46 points | 18 comments)
13. Rollstack (YC W23) Is Hiring TypeScript Engineers (Remote US/CA) ( | hide)
14. LegoGPT: Generating Physically Stable and Buildable Lego (525 points | 135 comments)

16. All BART trains were stopped due to ‘computer networking problem’ (131 points | 85 comments)
17. Show HN: Hyvector – A fast and modern SVG editor (218 points | 46 comments)
18. Show HN: BlenderQ – A TUI for managing multiple Blender renders (34 points | 3 comments)
19. CryptPad: An Alternative to the Google Suite (118 points | 30 comments)

21. Reverse Engineering "DNA Sequences" in the Lost World: Jurassic Park Video Game (13 points | discuss)
22. Data manipulations alleged in study that paved way for Microsoft's quantum chip (168 points | 119 comments)
23. Odin, a Pragmatic C Alternative with a Go Flavour (9 points | 2 comments)
24. The Anarchitecture Group (21 points | 3 comments)
25. NSF faces shake-up as officials abolish its 37 divisions (351 points | 451 comments)
26. Implementing a Struct of Arrays (103 points | 34 comments)
27. The birth of AI poker? Letters from the 1984 WSOP (36 points | 10 comments)

29. The CL1: the first code deployable biological computer (31 points | 15 comments)
